snippet: Chinese exports handily beat expectations in January, rising 10.6 percent from a year earlier, while imports jumped 10 percent.
abstract: Chinese exports handily beat expectations in January, rising 10.6 percent from year earlier, while imports jump 10 percent, leaving the country with trade surplus of $31.9 billion for the month.
lead_paragraph: Chinese exports handily beat expectations in January, rising 10.6 percent from a year earlier, while imports jumped 10 percent.

headline.main: China Trade Report Better Than Expected
headline.print_headline: China Trade Report Better Than Expected
